results.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Laurence Mark and Stephen Sommers
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of the classic 19th century novel ‘The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn’ by American writer, Mark Twain. This is a story about Huck Finn (Elijah Wood), a poor uneducated boy who has run away from home to escape his abusive drunken father, and Huck’s chance encounter with Jim (Courtney S. Vance), an escaped slave. Together the two follow the Mississippi River finding adventure and drama and some rather dubious characters by the names of the King (Jason Robards) and the Duke (Robbie Coltrane). Cast also includes Ron Perlman and Laura Bundy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Pictures, Laurence Mark and Stephen Sommers

results.title: The Adventures of Baron Munchausen
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Prominent Features, Laura Film, Thomas Schuhly and Terry Gilliam
results.brief_description: Baron Munchausen is a seventeen-century aristocrat with a taste for adventure and a tendency to embellish his past. The aging Baron decides to come to the rescue of a British town under siege from Turkish marauders. With this feature film Terry Gilliam (The Fisher King, Twelve monkeys, Brazil, Time bandits, Fear and loathing in Las Vegas) continues his penchant for elaborate costume drama/comedy involving expensive productions, extensive casting and complex detailed settings. The story follows Munchausen on a series of daring adventures including: ballooning to the moon, being swallowed by a whale, exploring the inside of a volcano, cheating the executioner’s axe and a date with Botticelli’s Venus. Travelling with Munchausen are the fastest man in the world, the man with the best hearing, the strongest man, a man with breath as strong as the wind and one girl who is the only person to thoroughly believe in him. Resplendent set pieces evoke memories of (and at times appears to reference) the more financially successful “Time bandits”. Cast and cameos include: John Neville, Uma Thurman, Eric Idle, Sarah Polley, Jack Purvis, Charles McKeowan, Robin Williams.

results.title: The Addiction
results.creator_credit: Fast Films, October Films, Denis Hann, Fernando Sulichin and Abel Ferrara
results.brief_description: Lili Taylor plays Kathleen, a philosophy student at New York University who is fascinated, repelled and obsessed with genocide and the Jewish Holocaust. One evening she is attacked in an alley by a woman (Annabella Sciorra). When Kathleen awakes from her ordeal she discovers that she has now developed a thirst for human blood and must come to terms with being a vampire in a modern city. This deeply unsettling horror film is a troubling study in evil and human nature. The stark black and white photography assists in creating an ethereal world in which the the terrors of the supernatural are at times indistinguishable from the terrors of everyday life; or for that matter from the disturbing post-war images in the documentaries that so obsess the main character. Since his early “B-grade” genre films in the early 1980s, Ferrara has committed himself to developing a uniquely personal American independent cinema which is unafraid of tackling some of the most crucial philosophical and spiritual concerns of the age. Reflecting a tortuous relationship to both his Catholicism and his love of the Hollywood genre, Ferrara’s films involve characters immersed in darkly amoral worlds. Kathleen’s ethical and political attempts to counter evil are constantly undermined by her very body and instincts which propel her towards savagery and violence. Ferrara’s assured direction means that “The Addiction” works effectively as a horror film but its real power arises from daring to address the combative relationship between rationality and instinct in the human psyche. Cast also includes Christopher Walken.

results.title: The Accidental tourist
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Lawrence Kasdan, Charles Okun and Michael Grillo
results.brief_description: Based on Anne Tyler’s best-selling novel, this multi-award winning film tells the story of Macon Leary and his eccentric family who insulate themselves from the real, messy world of relationships by constructing an elaborate series of routines and protective behaviours. Until, that is, Macon meets Muriel and his sister Rose meets Macon’s publisher. By turns funny and heartbreakingly sad, this film will linger in your memory. Cast includes William Hurt, Kathleen Turner, Geena Davis and Bill Pullman.

results.title: The Abyss [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Gale Anne Hurd and James Cameron
results.brief_description: An American nuclear submarine is mysteriously attacked by an unidentified vessel and when the crew of the submarine go deep into the ocean bed to investigate they find a force so powerful it threatens the future of humankind. Technically a masterpiece, with awesome set designs and special effects, and a chilling soundtrack, “The Abyss” is a terrifying movie. Directed by James Cameron (“Aliens”), “The Abyss” is an extravagantly mannerist example of the science-fiction genre in which the “dark force” is a mirror for the destructive powers which humans unleash on themselves.

results.title: The 39 Steps [DVD]
results.brief_description: Adapted from the novel of the same name by John Buchan. Using the style and technique that were to make him famous, Hitchcock gained immediate audience sympathy for the plight of his central character, an innocent Canadian, who while visiting England, is implicated in the theft of national secrets and murder. This fast paced, often humorous, spy/chase thriller pays homage to Buchan rather than being a close adaption of his novel and was later remade by Hitchcock as ‘North by North West’. The purpose of the chase - the MacGuffin as Hitchcock called it - becomes increasingly irrelevant except as the means of holding a series of vignettes together. Cast includes Robert Donat, Madeleine Carroll and Peggy Ashcroft.

results.title: The 3 worlds of Gulliver
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Charles H. Schneer and Jack Sher
results.brief_description: Adventurer Gulliver leaves home with dreams of drama on the high seas. Tragedy strikes however in the form of a storm, washing Gulliver to the shores of Lilliput; an island inhabited by people who are just a few inches high. Gulliver quickly wins their favour and is crowned hero when he is able to wipe the Lilliputians enemy fleet. After his experiences with the little people he travels to Brobdingnag; a country inhabited by giants. Gulliver is captured by the giants as a potential toy for the Queen of Brobdingnag. Special effects are courtesy of Ray Harryhausen. Starring Kerwin Mathews, Jo Morrow and June Thorburn.

results.title: The 13th Warrior = The Thirteenth Warrior
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Michael Crichton, Ned Dowd and John McTiernan
results.brief_description: Set in 922 AD, an Arab courtier accompanies a party of Vikings to the barbaric North where he is reluctantly enlisted to help them battle the flesh eating Wendol. Cast includes: Antonios Banderas, Omar Sharif.

results.title: That Obscure object of desire = Cet obscur objet du desir
results.creator_credit: Greenwich Film Production, Serge Silberman and Luis Bunuel
results.brief_description: Mathieu (Fernando Rey) is a self-satisfied Spanish businessman whose ordered, elegant life begins to fall apart when he becomes obsessed with the virginal Conchita, who professes love for him, but refuses to have sex with him. Based on a novel by Pierre Louys, “La Femme et le Pantin”, Bunuel’s film version is a comic exploration of the libidinous energies that undermine the precarious safety and order of the bourgeoisie. Though an assured and elegant film, Bunuel utilises surrealist touches, such as having two actresses play the same lead role (Carole Bouquet and Angela Molina) to unsettle and provoke the viewer.
